greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Sum_{k=1..n} (lcm(n,k)/gcd(n,k) mod n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Sebastian Karlsson, Formula for Prime Powers
formula: a(p^2) = A056789(p) for prime number p.
a(n) = 1 iff n is a prime.

a(p^2) = 1 + p^2(p-1)/2, if p is a prime. Sketch of proof: for an arbitrary term "lcm(n,k)/gcd(n,k) mod n", this is clearly 0 if n and k are relatively prime. If it isn't 0, then k = p*r < n for 1 <= r < p or k = n. Hence, a(p^2) = 1 + p*Sum_{r=1..p-1} r. Hence, a(p^2) = 1 + p^2*(p-1)/2.
If p is a prime then:
maple: a:= n-> add(irem(n*k/igcd(n, k)^2, n), k=1..n):
mathematica: a[n_] := Sum[Mod[LCM[n, k]/GCD[n, k], n], {k, 1, n}]; Array[a, 100] (* _Amiram Eldar_, Dec 03 2020 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = sum(k=1, n, lcm(n,k)/gcd(n,k) % n); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Dec 02 2020
results.author: _Sebastian Karlsson_, Dec 02 2020
